Today I spend my whole day in Sentosa alone. I was reading this book called " tuesdays with Morrie" by Mitch Albom. It is a true story capturres the simplicity beyond life's complexities. I found this book by accident, on a bus. And I only start reading it today and completed it too. I cried and laughed reading the book. There's a sentence said that "there are few rules I know to be true about love and marriage: If you don't respect the other person, you're gonna have a lot of trouble. If you don't know how to compromise, you're gonna have a lot of trouble. If you can't talk openly about what goes on between you, you're gonna have a lot of trouble.And if you don't have a common set of values in life, you're gonna have a lot of trouble. Your values must be alike."...Values is "belief in the importance of your marriage" A few days ago, I realised that my dear dear don't have feeling for me anymore. I realised I love him a lot but our values are different. It break my heart and I cry over it but I'll detach from it. It's another chapter of my life. _______________________________________________________________ "The very thought of you and I forget to do the little ordinary things that everyone out to do.... I see your face in every flower, your eyes in the stars above, it's just the thought of you, my love...." ________________________________________________________________ Quote "The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in."
